definition: to leave (a message etc)/to retain/to stay/to remain/to keep/to preserve
knife/blade/single-edged sword/cutlass/CL:把[ba3]/(slang) dollar (loanword)/classifier for sets of one hundred sheets (of paper)/classifier for knife cuts or stabs
to leave behind/to stay behind/to remain/to keep/not to let (sb) go
to keep/to retain/to have reservations (about sth)/to hold back (from saying sth)/to put aside for later
to stay somewhere temporarily/to stop over
to detain (a prisoner)/to keep sb in custody
to leave a message/to leave one's comments/message
student studying abroad/(foreign) exchange student/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
to be mindful/to pay attention to/to take note of

sentences.english: Don't eat up at one and you can have it after a while.
sentences.chinese: 别一下子全吃了，留一点过会儿再吃。

sentences.english: Of course, lots of cookies means some of them must be put away for later days.
sentences.chinese: 当然，大量的曲奇就意味着有一些会被留着以后再吃。

sentences.english: The soldiers of Baker Company , 31st Infantry, would be in reserve.
sentences.chinese: 陆军31步兵团的B连被留作为预备队。

sentences.english: Part of every crop is saved for seed.
sentences.chinese: 每一种庄稼都留一部分成作种子。

sentences.english: He has a distinctive goatee, so I can recognize him easily.
sentences.chinese: 他留着独特的山羊胡子，所以我很容易就认出他来了。

sentences.english: Is there a 'right' amount of money to leave to kids?
sentences.chinese: 你认为给孩子留多少钱才算合适？

sentences.english: Four xi think appropriate solutions of unfavorable knot, elected to day zhen also left behind.
sentences.chinese: 四喜认为冤家宜解不宜结，便将天贞也留了下来。

sentences.english: “I want that question mark there,” said Staub.
sentences.chinese: “我想这儿要留一个问号，”斯桃波说道。

sentences.english: I entreat you, give no place to despondency.
sentences.chinese: 我恳求你，不要为沮丧留地步。

sentences.english: Husband thinks pisciculture early, took aquarium place in the sitting room then.
sentences.chinese: 老公早就想养鱼，于是在客厅留了鱼缸位置。

sentences.english: Did you know 65 percent of women have curly hair?[1]
sentences.chinese: 你知道有65%的女士都留着卷发吗？
于是，他们便被留了下来。

sentences.english: During that period, the style for men was to wear their hair plastered down on their heads.
sentences.chinese: 在那个时期，男人们的时尚是留平滑头发。

sentences.english: There is no right way to dress or right way to wear your hair.
sentences.chinese: 怎样穿衣或者留什么发型，都没有所谓的对错之分。

sentences.english: Leave jewelery behind when you travel, and wear only a simple watch.
sentences.chinese: 旅行前先把珠宝留家里，只要带一般的表即可。

to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)
to send/to mail/to entrust/to depend on/to attach oneself to/to live (in a house)/to lodge/foster (son etc)
to set aside for/to keep as
to remain/to be left/to have as remainder
scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack
to ask sb to stay/to keep sb for the night/to await (classical)
to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means
scissors/shears/clippers/CL:把[ba3]/to cut with scissors/to trim/to wipe out or exterminate
